summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 among legal team members coordinating the privilege review of electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence focuses on reconciling inventory lists (NYC numbers) of devices between the FBI's records and what has been loaded into the Relativity review platform, identifying discrepancies and missing data.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The seized electronic devices being discussed belong to him. He is the central figure of the investigation.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the 'Maxwell case' and a discovery deadline. Some devices may be from her.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same legal case, with shared discovery deadlines and device review processes.

events.title: FBI Production to SDNY
events.description: The FBI produced data from numerous devices (identified by NYC numbers) to the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Devices Uploaded to Relativity
events.description: Reported date when extractions from seized devices were uploaded to the Relativity platform and ready for privilege review.

events.title: Maxwell Case Discovery Deadline
events.description: Upcoming deadline for discovery productions in the Maxwell case, driving the urgency of the device review.

keyFacts: The email chain reveals an internal effort to audit and reconcile the inventory of electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a complex evidence management process.
Significant discrepancies are noted between device numbers (NYC identifiers) on an FBI spreadsheet and those loaded into the Relativity review platform, with potential data missing.
The correspondence highlights the procedural steps for privilege review of seized devices, including the use of specific search terms and the walling off of data for attorney review.
The context is the impending November 9, 2020, discovery deadline for the related Maxwell case, creating urgency to complete the review of Epstein's devices.
